intro: Spermacoce dolichosperma, commonly known as the long-seeded moonflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
